definition: to stir up the fire/fig. to provoke and offend people/to ruffle feathers
to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
stir up the fire and you get burnt (idiom); to get one's fingers burnt/fig. to suffer on account of one's own meddling

sentences.english: Gnome pranksters have angered a village of humans.
sentences.chinese: 51侏儒的玩笑惹火了人類村莊。

sentences.english: Eg. She is gorgeous, a total knock-out with a killer body and she's just my dream girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是絕世的美女，身材惹火，簡直就是我的夢中情人。

sentences.english: Hey. To you guys and this hot dress and calamari.
sentences.chinese: 嘿，敬你們和這件惹火洋裝和炸花枝圈。

sentences.english: It's her ingratitude that grates on me.
sentences.chinese: 是她忘恩負義把我惹火了。

sentences.english: Do you guys ever get pissed off at eachother from being on tour and being stuck together for such long periods of time?
sentences.chinese: 在長時間的演出中，你們有沒有被其他成員惹火過？

sentences.english: Don't let your sister fire, otherwise on tonight's evening news.
sentences.chinese: 別把姐惹火了，否則讓邇上今晚的晚間新聞。

sentences.english: She is gorgeous, a total knock-out , with a killer body; she's just my dream girl.
sentences.chinese: 她是絕世的美女，身材惹火，簡直就是我的夢中情人。

sentences.english: Mr. BIG always do something invidious to make pink strip feel angry.
sentences.chinese: 藍色的畢哥每天總是做一堆把桃紅油條惹火的事。

sentences.english: Don't burn your fingers by getting too involved.
sentences.chinese: 不要介入得太深以致於惹火燒身。

sentences.english: The name of the hot young film star stirred Sinatra.
sentences.chinese: 這個年輕惹火的年輕電影明星的名字攪亂了辛納屈。

definition: to provoke/to irritate/to vex/to stir up/to anger/to attract (troubles)/to cause (problems)
not to be trifled with/not to be pushed around/stand no nonsense
unable to differentiate good from bad (idiom)/not to know what's good for one/unable to recognize others' good intentions
